####Results with Mean Speed of 100 km/hr
```{r}

library(ggplot2)

source("autopower.R")

# generate sample speeds from a distribution
nsample = 100
speeds = rnorm(mean=27, sd=2.7, n=nsample)

#create a dataframe that has rows for each model run
results = data.frame(speed=speeds, power=NA)

results$power = autopower(V=speeds, A=25, m=20000)

#Look at results
ggplot(results, aes(speed, power/1000))+geom_point()+labs(x="speed in m/s", y="power in kW")

#Calculate Mean
mean(results$power)

```

####Results with Mean Speed of 80 km/hr
```{r}
source("autopower.R")

# generate sample speeds from a distribution
nsample = 100
speeds = rnorm(mean=24, sd=2.4, n=nsample)


#create a dataframe that has rows for each model run
results2 = data.frame(speed=speeds, power=NA)

results2$power = autopower(V=speeds, A=25, m=20000)

#Look at Results
ggplot(results2, aes(speed, power/1000))+geom_point()+labs(x="speed in m/s", y="power in kW")

#Calculate Mean
mean(results2$power)


```
